text: this has been another extraordinary
development in what three days of
extraordinary of developments here at
Britain's second busiest airport the
latest emergency began just over an hour
ago when Gatwick announced they were
suspending flights yet again because of
what they described as a suspected drone
sighting just in the past few minutes
had come back to us and said that the
emergency the suspension has now been
ended and that they're satisfied flights
can be resumed in their statement they
said this was a precautionary measure as
safety remains our main priority and the
Gatwick statement goes on to say that
the military measures that we have in
place at the airport have provided us
with reassurance necessary that it is
safe to reopen our airfield these are
the unspecified military measures that
they put in place over the last 24 hours
to try and stop these drones taking off
from around the airport perimeter fence
it had been nearly 24 hours since the
last drone sighting until tonight's one
and the authorities were hoping that the
flights and the airport was getting back
to normal and indeed it had been for
something like six or seven hundred
flights getting away today that doesn't
mean to say there weren't delays and
frustrations there certainly were all
day long with many passengers being
delayed by hours and hours some way
couple of days because of the huge
backlog in getting back to normal but
things have been progressing the flights
have been going around about a dozen
flights were canceled and diverted
because of tonight's new emergency that
the one suspects that other flights will
now come in and planes on the ground
will start taking off but again it's
already going to take them and well into
the weekend to rectify all these
problems and that may be affected a
little bit more by this latest emergency
which has come to an end but passengers
should still continue to phone their
airlines before traveling to Gatwick and
hope that their planes will get off on
time although we're told tonight they
should still expect some delays at least
until Saturday and possibly
day as well
